alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 13 at 11:21AM AKDT until May 15 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...Yukon River downstream of Eagle to Takoma Bluff * WHEN...Through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of the Yukon River near the Tatonduk and Seventymile has Rivers has occurred with water surrounding several cabins. Ice jam flooding is possible in all areas along the Yukon River downstream of Eagle to Takoma Bluff. Impacts could range between minor or severe flooding. Large chunks of ice may push overbank. Now is the time to take precautions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Ice jams have been forming and releasing below Eagle to Takoma Bluff. A surge of water and ice from a large jam that was in place upstream of Eagle will be moving through this stretch of the Yukon River today. Further ice jams may form and cause significant flooding of cabins along the river. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc/ - If you live near or along Yukon River downstream of Eagle stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor local river conditions and prepare for the possibility of ice jam flooding. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Now is the time to move items to higher ground.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
